meanings.sent1: I precanceling my stamps to make sure they are ready to send.
meanings.sent2: She always precancels her stamps before mailing letters.
meanings.sent3: The post office worker was precanceling stamps with great speed and accuracy.
meanings.sent4: Precanceling the stamps felt like adding a final touch of preparation.
meanings.sent5: The process of precanceling made the stamps look official and ready for delivery.

meanings.definition: The act of canceling postage stamps before use.
meanings.sent1: Precanceling is an important step in preparing mail for delivery.
meanings.sent2: The precanceling of stamps helps prevent fraud in the postal system.
meanings.sent3: There was a workshop on the art of precanceling at the philately convention.
meanings.sent4: The precanceling machine hummed softly as it processed each stamp.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of precanceling lies in its efficiency and convenience for both senders and receivers.
